intro: Habenaria finetiana, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or brown streaks. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
